title: Fix bottom border clipping on split-view cards

requirements.text: Fix the UI so the bottom border of the Map and Table “border box” cards is fully visible and not clipped/misaligned in Split view (and remains correct in Map-only and Table-only views), matching the expected rounded card border shown in the screenshot.

quotes: fix the butttom of the boarder box

acceptanceCriteria: In Split view, neither the Map card nor the Table card has its bottom border (or rounded corners) clipped/cut off.
The fix works at common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop) without introducing new overflow/scrollbar artifacts.
Map-only view still shows a correct, continuous border around the Map card (including the bottom edge).
Table-only view still shows a correct, continuous border around the Table card and its inner bordered container.

requirements.text: Update the Split view layout container styling to avoid clipping card borders (e.g., remove or adjust any parent `overflow-hidden` / fixed-height wrappers that cut off the Card’s bottom border) while keeping the intended 600px panel height behavior.

quotes: fix the butttom of the boarder box

acceptanceCriteria: In `frontend/src/pages/EarthquakeDashboard.tsx`, Split view no longer uses wrapper styles that visually cut off the Card border.
Both panels remain the intended height (approximately 600px) and content remains usable (map visible, table scrollable).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this UI-only fix.
nonGoals: Adding new dashboard features or changing data fetching/filtering logic.
Changing the overall theme/colors/typography beyond what is necessary to fix the border rendering issue.
